hints.content:
There are $\blueD{5}$ tables.

The cafeteria has $\greenD{40}$ total seats.

[[☃ image 1]]

What is the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of equal lengths. The first tape is labeled 40 and the second tape with 5 equal parts each labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the second tape is labeled with the words 5 equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}\times\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}= \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\blueD{5}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{40}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}=\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}$

So, $\greenD{40}\div \blueD{5}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many seats are at each table are:

 - $\blueD{5}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{40}$
 - $\greenD{40}\div \blueD{5}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

question.content:
There are a total of $40$ seats at the $5$ tables in the cafeteria.  Each table has the same number of seats. 

**Which equations would help us find out how many seats are at each table?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
